alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Terrebonne, western Lafourche and southeastern Assumption Parishes through 300 PM CDT... At 214 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Amelia to near Cocodrie. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Schriever, Gray, Chauvin, Dulac, Labadieville, Bayou Cane, Cocodrie, Montegut and Lumcon Center Buoy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
